content.description: Yacht Club Delight is another good warm-up. Ascend a crimp ladder to a slopey topout.
content.location:
It is right of

Poncho's and Righty's

.

content.description: Start with your left hand on the incut crimp and your right hand on the jug sidepull. Pull on to a small, left hand crimp high, and find the right hand sidepull. The topout is a little slopey and probably will have lichen, so it might be worth while cleaning if you're going to do it.
content.protection: The landing is pretty solid with a flat rock, so a single crashpad will do.
content.location: This is North of the Grand Lake Lodge (uphill from it, slightly to the east, you can't miss it).

content.description: Follow a series of tiny crimps and rails, and reach up left to a small ledge. Finish straight above that.
content.location: It is in the parking lot for Poncho's and Lefty's Mexican restaurant. The route starts right at the end of the stairs.

content.description: Follow some edges to slopers on top.
content.location: It is located to the right of US Hwy 34, on the corner of Lake Ave. and Pondview Ln.

content.description:
This is a good warm-up to

Bada Bing, Bada Boom, and Some Coffee

and

Stairway to Heaven

. Follow crimps up to a slopey topout.
content.location:
It is #2 in the photo, to the right of

Bada Bing, Bada Boom, and Some Coffee

.

content.description:
This is the most committing line on this boulder. Start with your right hand on the arete and your right foot on a good hold. You could cut right or left once you are stood up with your feet at the 6 foot level. For this line, cut left, straight up the tall face on big, sloping compression feature.

It is maybe not super hard but pretty heads up - and you really don't want to fall with all those drunk tourists walking by....

This problem is a super nice line and maybe has the hardest moves on the bloc?
content.protection: It is probably best to have at least one pad below and one pad draped over the boulder below. More wouldn't hurt.
content.location: It is on the lowest part of the boulder with a small boulder below and to the right of you.

content.description: Begin on the left side of the south face (downhill-facing), climb right and up through 2 blocky overhangs, topping out at the highest point in the middle of the face. Originally this was climbed in Vans with no pads or spots. It is dedicated to Allen and Jean Miller.
content.location: This is just north of the Grand Lake Lodge (uphill from it, slightly to the east, you can't miss it).

content.description:
Huevos Rancheros is on the parking lot side of the boulder. Start with an awkward, gastoning mantle. Use edges to gain the small slab, and cruise to the top.

This is a good warm-up for the other side.
content.location: Parking lot side of the boulder, leftish corner.

climbs.name: Bada Bing, Bada Boom, and Some Coffee

content.description: This is a very slabby boulder problem, there is not much to pull up on except for miniature crimps, and to complete this, you must have complete confidence in your feet. The crux is almost at the top when you have you have to stand on a small foothold and grab onto the top which gives you nothing to grip.
content.protection: Be sure to bring a large crash pad and be careful the street is only a couple feet away.
content.location: Up the hill from The Wake Coffee Shop, this is the only boulder in sight.
